name: Harrison Ford, Actor Quiz | Harrison Ford | 15 Questions

questions.text: What kind of work was Harrison Ford doing in the 1970s to supplement his acting career?
questions.explanation:
carpentry.

	He's built many professional-level projects, including his home in Jackson Hole, WY and a recording studio.  It was while he was doing a carpentry job that George Lucas noticed him and cast him in "American Graffiti".

questions.text: The scar on his chin has been explained in his movies twice as hitting a toilet bowl after fainting after getting his ear pierced ("Working Girl") and getting hit by a whip ("Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade"). How did he really get it?
options: in fight with someone wearing a ring
self-inflicted; thought it gave him more character
questions.explanation:
in car accident.

	When he was 20.

questions.text: His second wife, Melissa Mathison, is a writer. In a movie she wrote, Ford had a small part, but it was cut because the director considered his presence would be too distracting. What movie was it?
questions.explanation:
E.T.

	He played the school principal.

questions.text: What actor played Harrison Ford's father in a movie, even though he was less than 12 years older than Ford?
questions.explanation:
Sean Connery & Connery.

	Connery was born August 25, 1930. Ford was born July 13, 1942.

questions.text: What actor in two different movies has played 1) Ford's character's son and 2) his younger self?
questions.explanation:
River Phoenix.

	As Charlie in 'The Mosquito Coast' and as a young Indiana in 'Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade'.

questions.text: Before 1970, Ford was credited as Harrison J. Ford to prevent confusion with a silent screen actor of the same name. What does the 'J' stand for?
questions.explanation:
nothing.

	Ford has no middle name.

questions.text: Ford hasn't been a regular cast member of a TV series. But he has had two guest appearances on this long lived TV series:
questions.explanation:
Gunsmoke.

	His characters were Hobey and Print.

questions.text: There is a hilarious scene in "Raiders of the Lost Ark" where Indy shoots a swordsman rather than fight him on his terms. It was originally scripted to be longer and not so funny. Why was this scene rewritten?
questions.correct: Ford was ill, and asked for it to be shortened
options: Ford didn't like the actor playing the swordsman, and asked his association with him to be lessened
budget constraints caused by Ford's large salary
Ford was running late to catch a plane home, so the scene was filmed shorter
questions.explanation:
Ford was ill, and asked for it to be shortened.

	Script originally included a long fight between a swordsman and Indiana with his whip. Harrison Ford was suffering diarrhea at the time, and asked if the scene could be shortened. "Why can't I just shoot him?" The entire crew laughed and that's how it was filmed.

questions.text: Ford has been called in to replace actors who have other commitments, much to the positive for his career. Which of the following actors, parts, and movies did Ford NOT substitute for?
questions.correct: Steve McQueen  in "Han Solo - Star Wars"
options: Tom Selleck - Indiana Jones in "Raiders of the Lost Ark"
Kevin Costner - President Marshall in "Air Force One"
Alec Baldwin - Jack Ryan in " Patriot Games"
questions.explanation:
Steve McQueen  in "Han Solo - Star Wars".

	Selleck was busy with 'Magnum PI', Costner with 'The Postman'. Baldwin supposedly had other commitments as well, but other reports say he either asked too much for salary, or was difficult to work with in "The Hunt for Red October".

questions.text: Ford has played a character named Henry in five different movies. Name the one movie that is not related to the other four.
questions.explanation:
Regarding Henry.

	His character's real name in the "Indiana Jones" movies was Henry Jones, Jr.

questions.text: What Humphrey Bogart part has Ford reprised?
questions.explanation:
Linus Larrabee.

	In "Sabrina", with Greg Kinnear and Julia Ormond.

questions.text: In which state does he maintain an 800-acre ranch?
questions.explanation:
Wyoming.

	He sometimes flies air rescue missions there, and flew his helicopter to rescue two female hikers in western Wyoming.

questions.text: Which one of his movies is his favorite?
questions.explanation:
The Mosquito Coast.

	He suggested his young co-star from "The Mosquito Coast", River Phoenix, to play the young Indiana Jones in "Indiana Jones & The Last Crusade".

questions.text: Ford has had two animals named after him: an ant (Peidole harrisonfordi) and what other type of animal?
questions.explanation:
spider.

	For narrating a documentary film, the Museum of Natural History named a spider (Calponia Harrisonfordi) after him.

5.

	Two each from each of his marriages and he adopted his third wife's child.
